Comments_Questions: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload  (amount of time required to prepare, in relation to the subject area and content)
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:

Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
Comments_List: Could probably fit more work into this course.
More sessions would be great but I understand that Harry is very busy.
The course didn't feel very organized - discussions wandered, and many important topics were only discussed after somebody asked a question about it.

I wish there was a real structure to this class. In fact, I had no concept of what to expect from this class as there was no syllabus and no real understanding of how to convey what he wanted from us.
I appreciate the levity Harry brings to the classroom. At times he is a bit abrasive, which can cause tension amongst students, but I never felt his comments were mean spirited.
He didn't seem to want to teach us. And that may have been a facade, but it made it harder to be in the room.
I will absolutely be referring to the agreements we created in this class when I begin seeking employment after graduation.
There wasn't a real structure to the class and so all of have is my assignments with my own notes on it. No readings or reference points other than Harry.

While the class certainly shouldn't be a lecture, it would be nice to have an idea/map/plan for where each session is going, and what they should cover, to make sure things aren't skipped if nobody remembers to bring them up.
I'm not sure this class needs to meet as many times as it does, particularly if it remains as small as it was this year.
Create a syllabus and a lesson plan.
